title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Victoria University of Wellington
Interview Descriptions: For a software engineering tutor role, there was no interview; they requested by email that interested applicants indicate which roles they were available for, and tutors were selected seemingly solely on the basis of grades.
Interview Questions: What courses are you willing to tutor?

title: Business Development Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Victoria University of Wellington
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is very structured to a point where they don't get to the core of who you are as a person. I think they should be more flexible and adjust questions accordingly.
Interview Questions: The interview questions were mostly situational and very specific.

title: Student Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Victoria University of Wellington
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fairly straightforward. It was an in-person-face to face interview and we basically just went through my CV, my motivations for the job and past work experience.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to become a tutor

title: Office Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Victoria University of Wellington
Interview Descriptions: Very detailed and engaging, lots of questions answered thoroughly and complete transparency. Comfortable and professional without being intimidating. Salary expectations confirmed and workload explained. Met other staff and was shown around the office.
Interview Questions: Expected salary for entry level position

title: Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Victoria University of Wellington (Wellington, Wellington) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview was straight forward. I interviewed with the hiring manager and their colleague, the interview lasted about an hour. There were a mix of some behavioural and situational questions. All the questions are pretty standard, I was not surprised by any questions.
Interview Questions: Describe how you manage your time, ensuring you finish all of your duties.

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Victoria University of Wellington (Wellington, Wellington) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very relaxed, a chilled out relatively quick interview with two friendly people. Asked fairly standard questions focused on getting to know you and your personality. Probably only lasted a maximum of 10 minutes.
Interview Questions: How will you balance the workload with your studies?

title: Accounting Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Victoria University of Wellington (Wellington, Wellington) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of situational questions on how to deal with 1st-year students and engagement in tutorials. It was also to understand my personality to see if I fit the role.
Interview Questions: How would you get students to engage in classroom discussion.

title: Marketing Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Victoria University of Wellington (Wellington, Wellington) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Informal interview that then led to a behavioural interview and then a final coffee catch-up. 
It was all as you would expect it to be and the hiring manager put you at ease. I'm guessing this varies from faculty to faculty/other departments.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time when you had to manage a difficult client/colleague.

title: Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Victoria University of Wellington (Wellington, Wellington) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions:
smooth and easy to discuss  with interviewer      smooth and easy to discuss with interview, also the process of hiring was smooth.
They have preset of questionarie for technical interview and were going through the list of pre defined question.

title: Accommodation Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Victoria University of Wellington (Wellington, Wellington) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was asked several standard interview questions. I had an interview with the manager and main office coordinator. Overall, it was a very relaxed interview, which made it easy for me to give thoughtful answers to their questions. The casual environment and demeanor of the interviewers made me less stressed.
Interview Questions: What skills did you gain from working in hospitality?

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Victoria University of Wellington (Wellington, Wellington) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview was for 1 hour and covered Behavioral and BA related questions, mostly on reporting experience and the type of projects.  There were a panel of 3 people - a Director, Manager and Business Analyst.

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Victoria University of Wellington (Wellington, Wellington) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Just have to submit an application, no real interview required. Also hiring based on academic grades. Not much to say about it really.

Also probably depends on department. Most departments require post grads to do tutoring, engineering/computer science do allow people that aren't post grads to tutor.

Good luck
